intro: Adromischus roaneanus, commonly known as the roanian sun rose, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, rounded leaves that are typically green with a slight red or purple tinge, especially when exposed to sunlight. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the growing season. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves. Adromischus roaneanus is a low-maintenance plant that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun.
